Detailed Description

Iterator class to access data from the class CImage, last updated 10/10/2001.

This class is not complete, only a few operators are overloaded. But it can be used as a basic iterator where the iterator is incremented with the ++ operator. This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CImageConstRowIterator1bp , CImage
Version:
0.20, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CImageConstColumnIterator1bp::CImageConstColumnIterator1bp (  UINT32    ColumnIndex,
UINT32    StartIndex,
UINT32    MaxIndex,
const TImage *    pTImg
)  [inline]
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
ColumnIndex  Index of actual row, without origo and ROI.
StartIndex  Index to start iteration from in actual row, without origo and ROI.
MaxIndex  Max index + 1, where iteration should end, used to set the return value for End(), without origo and ROI.
pTImg  Pointer to a TImage structure, a member of class CImage.

References TImage::ByteWidth, m_pCurrByte, and m_pTImg.

CImageConstColumnIterator1bp& ipl::CImageConstColumnIterator1bp::operator++ (    )  [inline]
 

overloading ++ operator.

Increments the pointer to data. Note: the postfix operator++ is not implemented in this class since the resulting code cannot be optimized. Using that operator would remove the point of using this iterator class.

UINT8* ipl::CImageConstColumnIterator1bp::m_pCurrByte [protected]
 

Pointer to byte containing the pixel value for actual index, using this in conjunction wiht m_PixelIndexInByte makes it possible to extract the actual pixel.

Updated when operator++ is used.

Definition at line 48 of file image_const_column_it_1bp.h.

Referenced by End(), operator *(), operator++(), ipl::operator<(), operator=(), ipl::operator==(), and operator[]().

unsigned int ipl::CImageConstColumnIterator1bp::m_PixelIndexInByte [protected]
 

Pixel index in actual byte containing the column for iteration, i.e.

the column index mod 8 since one byte contains 8 pixels. When iterating a column, this value stays constant. Set by constructor.
